Text.Value: And if nothing else, think of what's ahead. We need each other if we're going to survive this.
All right, but you have one chance, vampire. Mess up and you're gone.
Nothing big or terrible, just a small little detail about me that hasn't come up naturally.
We are a team. We need each other.
I told you to leave. Now!
It's just that I happen to be a - what's the best way to put this?
But you've been walking in the sun this whole time.
I shall be the very model of virtue, cross my heart and hope to - ...uh.
Fine, I'll go. But do me one favour: remember this moment.
Did our night together mean nothing to you?
A vampire?
Things haven't really changed - I'm still the same sweet, loveable rogue. My smile is just a little... sharper.
Oh come on, don't be like that.
I absolutely, categorically do not trust you.
Well... yes. Obviously.
And later, when that worm is bursting out of your face and you're trying to scream through your tentacles, remember that you chose this.
Then that will do.
So... was there anything else?
And I should just trust you not to bite me?
And by rights I should be cinders blowing in the wind, but something's protecting me.
I will not stand evil - leave!
Leave my party, leave my camp. If I ever see you again, it's a stake to the chest.
Now, was there anything else?
But that's neither here nor there. What matters is everything's out in the open now. Because we trust each other.

EditorData.NodeContext: He doesn't really believe what he's saying but trying to convince the player

Text.Value: The occasional night of passion aside.
But you can trust me. Of course you can - we're a team!

EditorData.NodeContext: He doesn't really believe what he's saying but trying to convince the player

Text.Value: The same something that's kept us from turning into mind flayers, no doubt.
That I can believe.
Hmm. Well, I suppose I can't fault you there.
You know, I've been thinking. And I think there's something I should tell you.
Well, we've made it this far without anyone sinking their teeth into anyone else.
Exactly! I knew I could rely on you. Just like you can rely on me.

EditorData.NodeContext: Do not rely on Astarion, dear player. He will eat you.

Text.Value: I'll be good. I promise.
Trust I don't want to be torn apart and reborn a mind flayer, then. Because this arrangement is my best chance to avoid that.
Right. Well. Glad we got that out of the way.

Synopsis: Astarion's default dialog - the dialog you'll get if you speak to him while you're just wandering around in the world. This will cover many different topics, filling out his background and expanding on plot points as they happen in the game. Be aware that at the start of the game, players will not be aware that Astarion is a vampire. These nodes have been marked in the context field.
